basics.name: Virginia Bauman
basics.summary: I'm a start-up executive and founder. I'm also a digital product manager and owner that has often focused on commerce. I own a small community focused brick and mortar business. I am a leader who focuses on management infrastructure, strategy, and organizational health.

work.summary: I've advised Go Get Em Tiger on knowledge work. Everything from management infrastructure to the details of web distribution strategy. I've also advised on fundraising, resource planning, culture and communications.
highlights: Built out web, social, and support teams.
Introduced and implemented OKRs, Executive Coaching, and helped fundraise.

work.summary: Cuties is a queer focused community organization and retail coffee bar in East Los Angeles.
highlights: Powered non-goal oriented queer community events for 5 years running.
Created a queer run coffee bar that is a tent-pole for the queer community in LA
Used email marketing to connect a disparate isolated community of marginalized individuals
Sold to Blue Bottle Coffee in 2014, every single team member shared in the purchase revenue.
Software infrastructure powers Blue Bottle to this day.

work.summary: Drop-ship and Subscription Marketplace for artisan food producers.
highlights: Raised $2mm from First Round Capital, and Softech VC
Built Ecommerce Engine from Scratch to Power Drop-ship Marketplace

references.name: Kyle Glanville
references.reference: What Virginia has brought to our team as an advisor is difficult to quantify. It is not simply that she is an expert in online retail, but that she has a way of clarifying muddy waters and cutting through nonsense incredibly quickly.

references.name: Ryan Brown
references.reference: With all of her experience, it would be easy for Virginia to give strict recommendations and advice, but the world is nuanced, and Virginia knows that everyone has to find their own way. I go back to Virginia again and again not because she tells me what to do, but because she asks me what I need to answer. She helps me understand the implicit tradeoffs and opportunity costs, and puts the ball back into my court with a defining question that only I can answer. This has an empowering effect where I come to trust myself for the decisions I've made.

references.name: Sarah Doll
references.reference: I learned things that year both fundamental and professional that I will carry with me forever.

references.name: Scott Rocher
references.reference: It takes a leader with business skills, unwavering passion, and focus to build a company from concept to acquisition.

references.name: Danielle Harris
references.reference: Virginia is the most efficient, effectively compassionate, and hard working leader I've come across. She’s able to coach, manage, research, and innovate with ease across multiple platforms and teams, always reminding stakeholders of the bigger business goals generating maximum productivity in any given situation.

references.name: Tam Vo
references.reference: Very rarely do you encounter leaders like Virginia—she leads by letting you choose your own direction, while encouraging, teaching, and inspiring you along the way. Because of this leadership quality, it's impossible not to want to create the best work possible and take on more challenges when she's at the helm of a project.
